intro: Pierranthus, commonly known as the Cape snowflake, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plants are characterized by their showy, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring and summer. They typically grow as shrubs or small trees, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Pierranthus species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant, long-lasting blooms.
